DOC.brief_summary: To evaluate ocular hypotensive efficacy safety PG324 Ophthalmic Solution compare netarsudil ( AR-13324 ) ophthalmic solution 0.02 % latanoprost ophthalmic solution 0.005 %
DOC.brief_title: Double-masked Study PG324 Ophthalmic Solution Patients With Open-angle Glaucoma Ocular Hypertension
DOC.criteria: 1 . 18 year age old ( 19 year age old Canada ) 2 . Diagnosis open angle glaucoma ocular hypertension eye 3 . Unmedicated intraocular pressure > 20mmHg < 36mmHg eye 2 qualification visit 4 . Corrected visual acuity equivalent 20/200 5 . Able give inform consent follow study instruction 1 . Clinically significant ocular disease 2 . Pseudoexfoliation pigment dispersion component glaucoma , history angle closure narrow angle 3 . Unmedicated intraocular pressure ≥36mmHg 4 . Use 2 ocular hypotensive medication within 30 day screen 5 . Known hypersensitivity component formulation 6 . Previous glaucoma surgery refractive surgery 7 . Ocular trauma within 6 month prior screen 8 . Any ocular surgery nonrefractive laser treatment within 3 month prior screen 9 . Recent current ocular infection inflammation either eye 10 . Used ocular medication either eye kind within 30 day screen 11 . Mean central corneal thickness > 620µm screen 12 . Any abnormality prevent reliable applanation tonometry either eye 13 . Clinically significant abnormality lab test screen 14 . Clinically significant systemic disease 15 . Participation investigational study within 30 day prior screen 16 . Used systemic medication could substantial effect intraocular pressure within 30 day prior screen 17 . Women pregnant , nursing , plan pregnancy use medically acceptable form birth control
